page.title: 11The School
page.content: Between 1813 and 1820 the then curate founded a charity school at Corton.It was financed by subscription and at it the children were taught to read and spell and the girls,in addition,to sew and knit.The first school house was built in 1833 on land on the East side of the street given by Mrs Mary Soame Fowler.It accomodated 60 older children and 20 infants who paid a fee of a penny a week.The present school was opened on 3rd. February 1896. The cost, of $1388 11s 2d, was met from local subscription and fund raising.
